title: Safety Training
description: Andy returns to the office after weeks of anger management training, determined to make a fresh start with all the Dunder-Mifflin employees. Meanwhile, it's safety training day in the office, and Michael and Dwight are on a mission to illuminate the dangers of the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Good morning, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, welcome back, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Drew.  I'm Drew now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.  Drew.  Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Apology not... accepted.  Because it wasn't even necessary in the first place. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Several weeks ago, Andy Bernard had an incident. [cut to shot of Andy punching a hole in the wall] But after five weeks in Anger Management, I'm back.  And I've got a new attitude.  And a new name.  And... a bunch of new techniques for dealing with the grumpies.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mornin' Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Andy.  How are you, man?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Good.  Drew.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dr-- You can call me Drew.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I'm not gonna call you that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Cool.  I can't control what you do.  I can only control what I do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Drew. [walks to Dwight] Dwight.  How's it goin' man?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, I have decided to shun Andy Bernard for the next three years.  Which I'm looking forward to.  It's an Amish technique.  It's like slapping someone with silence.  I was shunned from the age of four until my sixth birthday... for not saving the excess oil from a can of tuna.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, could you please inform Andy Bernard that he is being shunned.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, Dwight says welcome back, and he could use a hug.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, tell him that's not true.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight says that he actually doesn't know one single fact about bear attacks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You guys...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, no.  Jim, tell him that bears can climb faster than they can run.  Jim!  Tell him!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [half-heartedly] Andy!  Nah, that's too far.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today is Safety Training Day.  Toby is leading ours upstairs.  Yeauck.  But, I am giving everyone a little bit of a treat.  We are going to listen in on Darryl's presentation to the warehouse.  And if I know Darryl, it gonna be zoppity.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Now, this is the forklift.  You need-- [Michael rattles it] You need a license to operate this machine.  That means the upstairs office workers can't drive it. ... Quiz!  Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Should you drive the forklift?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can, and I have.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No! No no no no no!  I said should you.  You should not drive it.  You should not drive the forklift, you understand?

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: You're not allowed to drive the forklift.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's not safe, you don't have a license.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, I'm not the only one who's driven the forklift.  [points] Pudge has driven the forklift.

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: Madge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I thought your name was Pudge?

quotes.speaker: Madge
quotes.text: No, it's always been Madge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  Um, her.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Her.  Yes, "her" is qualified to work a dangerous machine.  You are not.  Okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, fine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Do you understand that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeeesh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We do safety training every year, or after an accident. ... We've never made it a full year.  This particular time, I was reaching for a supply box on the top shelf, when one office worker, who shall remain nameless, kicked the ladder out from under me and yelled...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [barely keeping his composure] "Hey Darryl, how's it hangin'?!" [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And I fell and busted my ankle.  I'm legitimately scared for my workers.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: The baler can flatten a car engine.  It can cut off your arm and crush your entire body without skipping a beat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's on!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How many people a year do you think get their arms cut off in a baler?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bail'er?  I hardly know her.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Dammit, Michael.  Pay attention, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Anybody wanna take a guess?  Anybody?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Five bucks says it's over 50.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You really wanna bet?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Anybody?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ever since March Madness ended, I am so bored.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: How many?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, you're on.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ten people, Michael. Ten people.  Would you like to be one of them?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [mouths] Damn...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [in background] You have to be alert, and calm. And always careful...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, don't worry about it.  We'll just got double or nothin'.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: On what?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know, we'll figure somethin' out.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What are you guys talkin' about?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: These are very dangerous machines down here, and the upstairs workers, Michael, should not go anywhere near them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, yes.  But it wouldn't be the worst thing in the world... if somebody...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It would be the worst thing in the world!  It would!  Very much so.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: What the hell is wrong with this man?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's a big red trash compactor!

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: What are you--

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's not a trash compactor!  It's a baler!

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Don't disrespect the baler!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay!  I got it.  I got it.  ...  Only on the rarest of occasions...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No do not touch it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...would I go near--

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: There is no occasion for you to go near this stuff, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby now has the floor...  and he is going to try not to screw this up, like everything else in his life.  Let me rephrase that.  I believe that you can do safety training and make it sound just as good as Darryl.  Here we go!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ok, um, one thing that you're gonna want to look out for is carpal tunnel syndrome.  It's recommended that you take a ten minute break from typing every hour.  For your circulation, you're gonna want to get up out of your chairs and uh, and move around about ten minutes every hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, good.  Fine.  Like stretching and...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Um, yeah.  You're computer screen can be a big strain on your eyes, so uh, it's also recommended that you step away for about... about ten minutes every hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow, that is... that time really adds up.  That's like... a half an hour, every hour?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Take them at the same time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, you know what?  You're making it sound kind of lame. So, skip ahead to the really dangerous stuff.  Like sometimes computers can explode, can they not?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, no.  Um, you always want to keep a sweater or cardigan of some sort, in case it gets drafty.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What about a long sleeve T?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, that'll work.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Long johns?  A shaw?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know, anything that warms you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, you know what?  I think that everybody is going to vomit due to boredom.  [to warehouse guys]  Sorry, he is very lame.  [takes book from Toby] Um, let's see.  "Seasonal affective disorder!  A depression that includes weight gain, fatigue, irritability, brought on by the low light of winter."

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thank God we only had a baler to deal with.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Yeah, that dim light is a bitch, ain't it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok guys, you know what?  I didn't-- I didn't interrupt when you were having your presentation.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Actually, you did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  Okay, let's do another one.  This is a good one.  "A particular concern for office workers is a sedimentary life style, which can contribute--"

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Sedentary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  "Which can contribute to heart disease."  Heart disease kills more people that balers.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: That's called having a fat butt, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmmm, no, no, it's... sedentary...

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.  That's, that's fat butt disease.  That's what you suffer from?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Fat butt disease, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Excuse me, sea monster, you weigh like a thousand pounds.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Yeah?  I bet you'd like to swim with this sea monster, wouldn't you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Dude, tell your girl to shut up.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly, you insulted the gentleman.  Please apologize.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Alright, we outta here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Darryl, I did not walk out in the middle of yours.  So, I--

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Yeah, but ours was real, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's what I've been trying to tell you, Mike.  It's serious down there.  We do dangerous stuff, man.  This is shenanigans, foolishness, Nerf-ball.  You live a sweet, little, Nerf-y life.  Sittin' on your biscuit.  Never havin' to risk it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  ... What, Nerf isn't cool anymore?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Darryl thinks he is such a man because he works in a warehouse.  I worked in a warehouse.  Men's Warehouse.  I was a greeter.  I'd like to see Darryl greet people.  Probably make 'em feel like wimps.  Not me, I...  "Hello, I'm Michael.  Welcome to Men's Warehouse.  We have a special on khaki pants today." ... This is one example.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Pam is holding a jar of jellybeans] Ten.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Really, ten?  That's your guess?  You're a professional accountant.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There's like ten green ones.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Forty-two.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna say fifty.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Fifty-one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, don't be that person.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That is lame.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: It's a strategy!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's called being smart.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, geeze.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know how the whole betting thing started, but it's fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ten...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kev's out.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: 47, 48, 49! Jim wins!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Oooh! [Jim claps]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That is not fair.  He has spent hours up here at reception with you.  Hours and hours.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, constantly.  Like, for years.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, depression is as scary as a baler, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't understand the question.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Working in an office can lead to depression.  Which can lead to suicide.  I mean this is really serious stuff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I-- I--  Nobody commits suicide because they work with a baler, and yet those guys are makin' fun of me, calling me a Nerf, that...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's really hard to demonstrate depression.  Their safety training had visuals.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah... you are... ah, so right.  They had visual aids.  And all we had were the facts.  You don't go to the science museum and get handed a pamphlet on electricity.  You go to the science museum and you put your hand on a metal ball, your hair sticks up straight... and you know science.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, you're okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Indubitably.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They use props.  They use visual aids, and they just made us look like dopes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Idiots!  God, what are we gonna do!?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, I don't know.  Because you know what our killer is?  Depression--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wolves.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nn-- Depression.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Visual aids.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A quilt.  Depression quilt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No time to sew a quilt.  ... I got it.  Give me the number for the Giant Big Box Toy Store.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You may be asking yourself, "What am I doing on a trampoline?"  Well, I thought I'd bounce here for a while, relieve some stress, and then move on with my day.  Not!  Here's the plan.  Dwight, is going to gather all of the office workers and all of the warehouse guys, we're going to have another safety seminar.  Only this time, where's Michael?  Oh my God!  He is on the roof!  Now I have got their attention.  I... tell them, about the cold hard facts of depression.  And then I say, "Hey!  You ever seen a suicide?"  And I jump.  And they freak out.  And they get to see... the dangers of depression with their own eyes.  Nice side note:

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So then the next movie moves to the top of the queue.  So number five becomes number four, number six becomes number five, [Ryan checks his watch]number three becomes number two, etc, etc.  And let's just say that I just sent back Love Actually, which was awesome.  [Karen lays money down on the desk next to Ryan] And they sent me Uptown Girls, which is also awesome.  But guess what, now I want to see love actually again, [Phyllis throws her money down] but it's at the bottom of the que!  Oh no, what do I do!? [Creed throws his money down] What I do, is this.  I go online, I go click, click, click.  And I change the order of the que, so that I can see Love Actually [Pam throws her money down] as soon as I want to.  It's so easy, Ryan.  Do you really not know how Netflix works? [Jim throws his money down]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I guess I forgot. [kisses Kelly, gathers up all the money]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You're such a ditz.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ryan, well done.  Two minutes, forty-two seconds.  Additionally, Pam, you win ten because she said "awesome" 12 times, and Jim, you win five because she mentioned six romantic comedies.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the roof] Okay, let's do this thing!  I'll go summon the troops!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe we should test it first.  Letterman-style.  Throw a TV over, or...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We measured it once...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go buy some watermelons.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Seedless?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [Creed takes a bite of an apple] Creed is eating an apple.  I found a potato.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hello. [Jim replaces Creed's apple with a potato][Creed takes a bite of the potato]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Here you go. [hands money]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I don't know this place as well as I thought I did.  I'm getting cleaned out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's do it!  Drop that sucker.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [drops watermelon, watermelon bounces off trampoline, onto a car, bursts, car alarm sounds]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: BINGO!  WHOA WHOA WHOA!  Oh... crap.  Deactivate the car alarm.  Clean up the mess.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Find out whose car that is.  If it's Stanley's, call the offices of James P. Albini, see if he handles hate crimes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Also, take apart the trampoline, stick it in the baler.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We're not allowed to use the baler.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have Pa-adge do it, or... the sea monster.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm on it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm temporarily lifting the shun.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It means nothing.  I need you to do something for me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, calm down.  I need you to acquire an inflatable house, and/or castle.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You mean a moon bounce.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What do you think?  You've got an hour.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm gonna need... I'm gonna need petty cash.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shunning resumed.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you, do you want a drawbridge?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Un-shun.  Yeah that sounds good.  Re-shun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh yeah, this is much better.  Safer.  Excellent decision.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, thank you for seeing that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When you land, try and land like an eight year-old.  These bouncy castles are not designed for adults.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know if I wanna do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you wanna do another test?  I got plenty of watermelons in my trunk!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.  No more.  The tests are going terrible.  If we keep doing it, we're not gonna want to jump.  This is about doing, not thinking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's right!  Doing!  Totally doing!  It's rock n' roll!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Rock n' roll!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's right!  I am not thinking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [imitating the sound and playing an air guitar] Near near near near near!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes!  Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] Michael is awesome!  Jumpin' off the roof!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] Bouncin' on the bouncy bounce!  Show 'em who's boss!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] Rip a hole in the suuuuuuun!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am ready to do this!  I am ready to make a point! [Dwight continues air guitar]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [out of breath] Guys!  Listen up!  Michael is up on the roof, and acting strange!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa!  What's the situation?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [hesitates] Un-shun.  I think he's suffering from depression. Re-shun.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok, when's the shunning thing gonna end?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Un-shun.  Never.  Re-shun.  I think he wants you all to come out to the parking lot and watch him die!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is it nice outside?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's gorgeous.  Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Do I need my jacket?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No really, it's, it's very nice.  Come on!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Will I be too warm in a long sleeve T?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everybody's gonna be fine in exactly what they're wearing, let's go!  Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [outside] Come on, hurry up you guys!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the roof] My life!  Oh, my life...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on megaphone] Michael, what's wrong?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everything's wrong.  The stress of my modern office, has caused me to go into a depression.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Depression?  Isn't that just a fancy word for feeling bummed out?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, you ignorant slut.  Depression is a very serious illness.  Over 32 thousand people commit suicide every year!  According to a 2004 study!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is that the last year the data was available?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes!  My head is in such pain!  And turmoil!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't do anything rash!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, where are the warehouse guys?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I didn't... [Dwight runs up to the side of the building] I didn't think you needed them for this part.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay... that's...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: you said to just...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's the whole point, dummy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I'm on it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Attention blue collar workers!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are the odds that this is in any way real?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'd say like... 10,000 to 1?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, I'd like ten bucks on those odds.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: If someone gives you 10,000 to 1 on anything, you take it.  If John Mellencamp ever wins an Oscar, I am going to be a very rich dude.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael's up on the roof and he's acting strange!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oooooh, my life!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael!  What's wrong?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everything is wrong, Dwight.  The stress of my modern office, has made me depressed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Depressed?  Isn't that just a fancy word for feeling bummed out?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, you ignorant slut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you know, the first performance was a little off.  But I really think they hit their stride, in the second show.  Um, might even bring my parents tomorrow, to the matinee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And that is why, I am going to jump off this roof!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, excuse me.  It's my... favorite part.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is just offensive.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: At least we're outside.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [zipping up his pants] Hey, check it out, there's a... there's a castle over there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, there is a castle.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, there's nothing to see over there, people!  There's nothing to see.  ...They found the castle, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh... God.  Oh my God, he's gonna jump.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.  He's going to kill himself, pretending to kill himself.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey uh, Michael.  Don't jump on the bouncy castle.  You can't do that, because you're going to get horribly, horribly injured.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Michael!  I have a present for you, but you have to come down and get it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come down and... open it and you'll see.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, find out what the present is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, uh... I don't see anything.  She might be bluffing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, what are you--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh... It's uh, a Repliee Q1 Expo female robot, they're only available in Japan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, you are such a liar.  Pam, really, what is it?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, this is the opposite of safety.  You jump, you're gonna serious hurt yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You told me, that I lead a... cushy, wimpy, Nerf life.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, but I never said you had nothing to live for.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do I have to live for?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: A lot... of things.  Uh, you, uh... What about Jan?  Lovely, lovely, lovely Jan, man.  It's goin' good, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's complicated with Jan.  And I don't know where I stand, or what I want.  The sex isn't nearly as good as it used to be.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, you're a very brave man.  I mean, it takes courage just to be you.  To get out of bed every single day, knowing full well, you gotta be you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you really mean that?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I couldn't do it. I-- I ain't that strong.  And I ain't that brave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm braver than you?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Way braver!  You Braveheart, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I Braveheart.  I am.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Come down, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  Pam, I'm coming down to get my present.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: An office... is as safe as the people in it.  And sometimes those people can drive you to do crazy things to show the dangers of the office.  That's the danger I found myself in today.  I saved a life.  My own.  Am I a hero?  I really can't say.  But, yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: When people think of Andy, they think of hate and anger. When people think of Drew, they think of baked goods.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, these cookies have no flavor. How is that possible?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: They are the worst. Who's this Drew chick?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Drew isn't a girl... She's Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh no, nobody likes my cookies. I'm so angry, argh I want to hit something. [laughs] Totally kidin' guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Little device I learned to diffuse tension, be the first to make fun of yourself, because if they make fun of you before you do... Then you might lose your mind.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [pours the last of the coffee into his mug]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ahhh... Is that the last of it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's OK. I can't always have what I want, but I can always want what I have.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, would you like a cup of no coffee? 'Cause that's what we have.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is it fresh? [winks]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are you going to beat me up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Umm... [draws back arm] No. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: People don't need to be afraid of me. I can't achieve anger any more, and I have a new car. Toyota Prius, because Andy didn't care about fuel efficiency, but Drew has seen "An Inconvenient Truth". Nearly twice.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [walks around Andy's new car keying it]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, come on everybody, go time. Pam let's go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I thought I'd stay and answer the phones.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't worry Pam, you will be answering phones for the rest of your life... Your long lovely life. [whispers to camera] saved it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Field Trip.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Step lively. Single file everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like we're going to the science museum.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's single...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Learn by touching.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Single... OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've been told that I'm a tactile learner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Buddy system, everyone buddy up, find a buddy.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You should work out Ryan, you would look so hot.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Totally, we should both work out.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Screw you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kelly, Ryan looks great. You should be thankful that you...

quotes.speaker: Larry
quotes.text: Sir, could you please, please focus on Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Larry
quotes.text: Try.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Summing up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sum it up Darryl, sum it up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We got beat today, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But it was not a fair fight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No it was not. Remind me again, what was the fight exactly, who was it between, and what was the outcome?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was the warehouse guys...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ... Dwight, they embarrassed us...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Argh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ... because they had a much scarier safety presentation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ghaaa!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what's funny? Robin Williams. [sighs] When a cat gets stuck in a washing machine. City Slickers. Talking like Borat. You know what's not funny? Safety, or making fun of the person trying to talk about safety. [in Borat voice] Not nice. I must show people how dangerous office can be. High five... Now that's funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do you make depression sexy? How do you... How do you get people interested in depression? That is the conon... the conun... the conumbery

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Those warehouse guys, think that we are all flabby, middle management, nerf balls. Well I'm going to show them that we have nerfs of steel. [winks]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Michael, Andy, and Dwight are standing around a trampoline] You know guys, I recently learned some pretty cool stuff about the difference between feeling something and... acting on that thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can you tell Andy to focus on the springs? Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, Drew.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes bosses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know Drew, why don't you go inside. Dwight come here. Where should we put this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, ahh, turn around, and do a broad jump for me on go. Ready... Go! One Mississ... OK, you went that far on one Mississ. Ippi would take you to here. This trajectory times the propulsion from your quadriceps would be about three Mississippi, maybe three and a quarter. So one Mississ... correct... ippi, two Mississippi, three Mississippi... e. Right here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, good. Thank you. Wanna take our time, do this right.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [phone rings] Hello?  Hi Bob Vance. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: That's three times in ten minutes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Where's my five dollars?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You are my little teddy bear. I wantcha.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I always knew my co-workers were annoying. I never realized I could profit from it. Go ahead Bob Vance, call Phyllis, all day.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Michael is up on the roof of the building] Michael, go ahead, we're listening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going to wait. I don't want to say this twice, it's too painful and I'm too depressed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [talking through bullhorn] Michael, you can not fly, you can not, I've seen this too many times.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Give me that thing, I want to try.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, you know what we should probably preserve the batteries.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I was just going to say that [yells toward Michael] you have a cute butt. Oh my God I did not just say that, did I just say that? Oh my God I'm so adorable.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know the timings bad, but I hate to be a nudge, but there's stuff that he has to sign that needs to be mailed by four.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, if he's not down by four, I'll get the papers up to him.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: OK, it's three forty eight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, Ryan you know what? You can do this.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, no, I have no training in this sort of thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Don't play dumb, you know damn well what we talking about.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on. He'll listen to you.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Come on Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on pretty boy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael, you have always taken a great interest in my career.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will miss you the most Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, what is your deal man!? Seriously I don't get it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let me borrow that chief. Michael, you don't have to prove anything to anyone but yourself. So don't jump just to prove anything to us. OK? That said, if you need to prove something to yourself, you should jump.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Up to you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No no no!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If you do jump, I want you to reach for the sky.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. careful, thanks. [takes bullhorn from Andy]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Grab a comet and kiss the moon! Kiss it!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: See this is why you always take ten thousand to one. You never know.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You own a convertible. Come on man that's, that's hot. Women love that stuff right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's only leased, and it's got rust damage, he'll never get his deposit back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Coal miners, crab fishermen, Dog the bounty hunter, all dangerous jobs. But also upper middle management. [takes deep breath] Wow! I could have fallen off a roof today... And you don't worry about falling off a roof when you work on a crab boat... And there are no roofs in coal mines.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in parking lot] Goodnight Stanley. [sees his car is keyed, just nods his head]
